CatDescriptText: Clayton Lipscomb, stock clerk, Homestead and James McCaffery, auto mechanic, Moon Township, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 8, 1961, pg. 7with question: "Do you think there will be a Third World War?  If so, what do you think will be the cause or causes?"  Clayton Lipscomb's answer reads: "There may be World War III, but not now.  Russia, as well as the United States, knows that each is very powerful.  Therefore, they won't take the chance of trying to force each other into unnecessary war.  What they probably will do is try a peace plan and git [sic] down and talk it out.  But if Russia moves, we will move."  James McCaffery's answer reads: "There could be World War III.  And if so, the cause will be Russia or, maybe, the Chinese Communists who are cocky and aggressive."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Clayton Lipscomb wearing moustache, patterned shirt, and coat with toggle buttons, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of James McCaffery wearing dark brimmed hat, plaid shirt, zippered jacket, and tweed coat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
